snippet: The leader of France’s National Front has worked hard to sanitize the party’s image, but her tough stance on ‘‘illegals’’ harks back to its origins and goes down well with supporters.
abstract: France's right-wing National Front party, whose image leader Marine Le Pen has tried to rehabilitate, remains stringently anti-immigration; Le Pen acknowledges surge in popularity even while stoking paranoia about influx of Syrian migrants, even though most refugees are choosing to settle in Germany or Sweden.
lead_paragraph: The leader of France’s National Front has worked hard to sanitize the party’s image, but her tough stance on ‘‘illegals’’ harks back to its origins and goes down well with supporters.

headline.main: For Marine Le Pen, Migration Is a Ready-Made Issue
headline.print_headline: French Far-Right Leader Finds Ready-Made Issue

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis
